name: Cantila Beach
description: You reach the water's edge. The stones almost sing as they roll back and forth in the waves. The path continues eastward into a small fishing town.

name: Uragota Town
description: The small town is quite lively. Situated on the main coastline road, there are a number of shops and an inn to stay at. The road leads through the town and out of sight along the coast.

name: West Uragota Docks
description: The western side of the docks is mostly used for smaller boats. A number of fishermen sit at the edge with lines in the water. There's also a kiosk with a sign saying, "Boats Fore Sail" in poorly written letters on the front.

buildings.name: Mound's Boats
buildings.description: The kiosk is run by a man named Gordo, who greets you nervously as you approach him. It appears to be selling both large and small fishing vessels.

name: East Uragota Docks
description: The eastern side of the docks contains the larger fishing vessels, as well as a ferry service to the northern isles.
